report_title: Offshore Oil Rig & Platform Construction in the US
executive_summary: Offshore oil rig and platform construction plays an important role in the United States' energy sector. Growing oil production caused industry revenue to increase at the beginning of the five-year period to 2023. Still, oil price weakness started shortly thereafter and weighed heavily on industry performance, resulting in revenue declines which persisted several years. Also, the COVID-19 pandemic caused all types of travel activity to slump, further lowering oil prices and hampering the purchasing power from upstream oil companies. Offshore oil rig and platform construction revenue has plummeted at a CAGR of 6.7% over the past five years and is expected to total $2.4 billion in 2023, when revenue will fall an estimated 12.8%. Profit will marginally increase as both the cost of labor and purchases drop.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: HIGHLY VOLATILE CRUDE OIL STEEL PRICES CONSTRAIN GROWTH
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Through the end of 2023, revenue has fluctuated along with volatile crude oil prices. The world price of crude oil dropped amid the COVID-19 pandemic as complications significantly disrupted all types of economic activity. The world price of oil rebounded in 2021 as the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) curbed its production levels. This trend continued through 2022, causing industry revenue to grow for the year. Crude oil prices will once again drop in 2023, further constraining upstream demand and industry selling prices, further contributing to the overall decline in performance.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: DEMAND SEVERELY SUFFERED AMID THE PANDEMIC
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The onset of COVID-19 resulted in a sharp decline in both domestic and international travel activity, as countries across the world implemented travel restrictions and lockdown measures to slow the spread of the virus. Due to this, aggregate demand for oil fell abruptly and dramatically, which translated into a rapid fall in the world price of crude oil. This trend was aggravated by a price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia, as Saudi Arabia implemented a sharp oil price cut after Russia refused to agree to an OPEC demand to jointly cut oil production. Oil prices began to rapidly fall even further, causing demand for offshore oil rig and platform construction services significantly declined.

Hydraulic fracturing and directional drilling techniques spurred a boom in US energy production over the past five years. These techniques enabled upstream oil and gas producers to dramatically increase production of previously uneconomical resources. Due to this, the United States improved its position in the international energy market. Still, environmental concerns remained high alongside production capabilities, as the lingering memories of the Deepwater Horizon oil spill kept offshore drilling in the forefront of the environmental debate about oil and gas production.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: OFFSHORE WORK IS MORE VOLATILE AND TIME CONSUMER THAN ONSHORE PRODUCTION
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Though prices were relatively high over the past five years, offshore oil and gas production is risky and expensive compared with onshore production. The construction process for offshore oil and gas rigs takes a long time, with many component parts manufactured abroad in Asia. Singapore, South Korea and China dominate the market for offshore oil and gas rigs, while the US industry is primarily focused on jack-up rigs, assembly, repair and maintenance services. This trend has been steady over the past five years, as the United States currently only has one active shipyard constructing offshore rigs in Brownsville, TX.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE GOVERNMENT IS HEAVILY INVOLVED IN INDUSTRY OPERATIONS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry is exposed to government decisions regarding offshore oil and gas drilling activity. Prior to the current period, then-President Obama lifted the moratorium on crude oil exports from the United States. In 2018, then-President Trump announced a proposal to open nearly all offshore waters to drilling. Still, this has endured intense opposition from both environmental groups and state governments in coastal states, such as Florida, North Carolina and California. The current administration announced a plan to roll back many of the safety regulations implemented in the aftermath of the Deepwater Horizon disaster. Due to this, oil and gas producers may expand their offshore operations moving forward in response to the prospect of a looser regulatory environment, which has the potential to boost industry revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Strong Production to Persist, but Prices Will Remain Unfavorable
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Oil and gas production will continue expanding at a healthy pace over the next five years. This growth will largely be driven by onshore shale deposit extractions, but offshore activity will strengthen during the outlook period. As the end of COVID-19 quarantine measures and lockdown restrictions fuels a pent-up demand for travel and other economic activity, aggregate demand for oil will increase. Despite this, the world price of crude oil will endure sharp declines but will still remain higher than pre-pandemic levels. Even though oil prices are set to drop, the rate at which this will happen will be relatively subdued, enabling upstream companies to more effectively plan out future projects.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A REDUCTION IN PRICE VOLATILITY WILL AID THE INDUSTRY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Though production will remain robust, regulatory and environmental concerns have the potential to affect the industry over the next five years. Volatility in the price of oil and steel directly affects demand for offshore oil and gas rigs, as companies often plan the construction of offshore rigs and platforms years in advance of their potential use. Due to this, if the world price of oil declines significantly, companies in offshore oil rig and platform construction could encounter delayed and canceled projects. Still, demand should remain strong for offshore oil rig and platform construction services as existing oil and gas platforms and rigs continue to age. Also, oil is on pace to decline at a less volatile rate compared with the prior period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: POTENTIAL THREATS COULD POSSIBLY HINDER INDUSTRY PERFORMANCE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Commodity price volatility will continue to pose a threat to offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors, as exogenous events have the potential to drastically alter the landscape for oil and gas producers. Uncertainty surrounding the extent and timing of the economic recovery following the recession fueled by the COVID-19 pandemic may also adversely affect growth in industry revenue. Also, slowing growth from emerging markets and uncertainty about the future development of shale resources in Countries such as Russia and China could potentially dampen the industry's performance over the next five years.

industry_definition: This industry constructs offshore drilling platforms, also known as oil rigs, for oil exploration companies. Many operators also provide offshore platform support services.

positive_impact_factors: high - steady Barriers To Entry Level

opportunities: US oil and gas production index
threats: Safety concerns remain paramount in the industry and any potential catastrophic event could drastically alter the regulatory landscape for offshore oil and gas drilling.

The environmental impact of offshore oil and gas drilling will also continue to play a prominent role in the industry's operations. Due to this, offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors must actively manage their backlogs and existing partnerships to hedge against detrimental events that could occur over the next five years.

key_trends: Regulatory uncertainty, weakening oil prices and strong onshore production constrained demand for new rig construction
Directional drilling techniques spurred a boom in US energy production
Profit is driven by wage cost and material price management, as machinery has become more prevalent in shipbuilding activities
Oil and gas production will continue expanding
Strengthening demand conditions for the industry will help companies maintain profit
Commodity price volatility will continue to pose a threat

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market is considered ultra-deepwater drilling and often consists of offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors of drills capable of drilling at depths between 10,001.0 and 12,000.0 feet. The construction of these rigs is extremely expensive and often consists of drill ships and semi-submersibles.

This market is considered the shallow drilling market and is made up of customers that often operate jack up rigs. The number of companies serving the shallow drilling market is more competitive than the deepwater drilling market.

This market is considered mid-water to deepwater drilling and consists of drilling offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors that drill for oil and gas at depths between 501.0 feet and 10,000.0 feet. Much of the construction activity for this market slowed as oil drillers seek to explore deeper depths.

products_and_services.product_description: Jack-ups are often towed into place, then the structures legs are lowered to the sea floor and before being "jacked up", which raises the platform out of the water. Jack-ups often operate at depths below 500 feet and are easily moved from one location to another, making them a popular choice for exploration projects.

Semi-submersibles are a platform supported by pontoon structures, which are filled with water and other dense materials to stabilize the platform. According to Rigzone, the average day rate for a semi-submersible can be as high as $373,000. There are four different types of semi-submersibles, each with a different design and meant to be operated at certain depths.

Drill ships are self-propelled mobile rigs that drill for oil through a large hole located in the center of the boat, often referred to as a moon pool. Drill ships are attractive since they can simply move on to the next job after drilling a well. Still, these rigs are extremely expensive, and production has stalled over the past five years.

Other rigs and platforms include tender rigs, inland barges, drill barges, fixed-platform rigs and submersibles. Most revenue from the other segment is derived from servicing, upgrading and maintaining existing rigs in offshore environments.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for offshore oil rig and platform construction's products is largely determined by the performance of oil and gas extraction companies, which is heavily dependent on global prices of oil and gas. When oil and gas prices increase, downstream companies are more likely to pursue unconventional resources that may be uneconomical in low-price conditions.

As energy production grows, older equipment and machinery will depreciate due to the corrosive nature of oil and gas. This also boosts demand for offshore oil rig and platform construction services, as industry customers need to make repairs or replace older platforms.

Offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors must provide high value-added products that meet safety and environmental standards. In light of high profile deepwater drilling accidents, ensuring safety and meeting regulatory standards has become extremely important.

Demand for offshore oil rig and platform construction is influenced by the number of offshore oil and gas leases sold by the US government. The more leases sold by the government, the more demand for offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors can construct oil rigs and platforms.

The purchase of new equipment by downstream offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors is also influenced by factors such as tax rates, capital allowances, depreciation, the cost and selling prices of secondhand equipment and the cost of repairs and maintenance to existing or secondhand equipment.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors often construct offshore oil rigs and platforms near the operation site. Construction of offshore oil rigs and platforms in areas near downstream users limits transport costs and improves competitiveness. Any trade that occurs happens at the manufacturing level.

business_locations.location_description: The distribution of establishments is concentrated in the Florida panhandle. These locations are ideal for offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors due to their access to the Gulf of Mexico. Industry players Gulf Island Fabrication Inc. and McDermott International Inc. (McDermott) have a large presence in this region.

The region provides offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors with convenient access to raw materials, saving on transportation costs. The Great Lakes includes many automotive companies that use oil, causing upstream oil companies to gravitate here.

Texas accounts for the large number of establishments in this region. Texas's access to the Gulf of Mexico makes this an attractive region for offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors. As mentioned previously, the largest shipyard for oil and gas drilling rig and platform construction is in Brownsville, TX.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Offshore oil rig and platform construction is subject to stringent engineering and construction specifications; failure to meet these requirements can result in substantial fines.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE BUREAU OF SAFETY AND ENVIRONMENTAL ENFORCEMENT
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement has established new regulations regarding casing installation and blow out preventer's inspections and maintenance, among other things. These regulations have caused offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors to update old platforms to comply with changing regulations.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE CLEAR WATER ACT (CWA) AND THE RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT (RCRA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: Under the CWA and RCRA, contractors are responsible for ensuring that appropriate water and solid waste discharge procedures have been followed. They are also subject to specific provisions relating to airborne pollution emissions.

The CAA is designed to protect and enhance the nation's air resources to protect public health and welfare. It establishes limits to air pollutants, including carbon monoxide, nitrous oxides, sulfur oxides and other particulate matter.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The CERCLA regulates the release and remediation of hazardous substances. Contractors endure substantial monetary consequences when found in violation of environmental standards.

Contractors are governed by laws and regulations relating to workplace safety and worker health. OSHA covers several topics relating to worker safety, including breaks and mealtimes, noise levels and dust standards. Companies are also held accountable to various state OSHAs, which may vary from their federal counterpart.

Regulations pertaining to client industries. For example, oil and gas extraction is subject to intense regulation concerning the environment and where exploration and extraction activity can take place. The federal government and many state governments play a large role in determining the areas that are open to oil exploration and extraction, which can influence demand for related oil products.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act (OCSLA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: This act applies to only downstream users of offshore oil rig and platform construction services and gives the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management (BOEM) the authority to approve offshore oil leases. Offshore leases are granted to the highest qualified bidder, which must then comply with all regulations. The act has also established an oil spill liability fund to cover any damages in the event of an oil spill. Also, a portion of the funds received from issuing leases must be distributed to coastal states.

In response to Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) guidance, various levels of regulation have been implemented in the United States and overseas to discourage public gathering, large events or crowded, unsafe work environments. Restrictions are easing in 2023 due to the widespread distribution of the COVID-19 vaccine.

basis_points.basis_description: Offshore oil rig and platform construction is characterized by a moderate level of competition. Companies compete predominantly on the basis of reputation, price, ability to meet regulatory standards and technology.

Due to the high stakes' nature of drilling for hydrocarbons, reputation is extremely important. Offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors known for the most skilled engineers and being able to optimize performance will have the strongest success.

It is important offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors meet customers' delivery schedules; lower amounts of down time make rigs more profitable for exploration and production establishments.
Industry participants that are best able to meet these conditions will have the most success securing contracts.

While oil rigs and platforms are extremely expensive to operate, purchasers of offshore oil rig and platform construction services do have budgets. The ability to produce a quality product on budget and on time is vital to an offshore oil rig and platform construction contractor's success.

Due to the limited number of shipyards capable of performing construction of offshore oil rigs and platforms, offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors that have ample space to work on several projects at once are better able to meet deadlines and will have a competitive advantage over competitors.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Market share concentration is low due to the high barriers to entry
Offshore oil rig and platform construction has a low level of concentration despite having a relatively small number of total companies.

Market share concentration decreased over the past five years as volatility in oil prices caused the major companies in the industry to struggle, opening up space for smaller companies to gain market share.
Since some of the larger companies have been better equipped to absorb fluctuations in oil prices, their market share has remained relatively stable over the past five years.

Still, industry-specific revenue for large contractors has fluctuated along with the volatility of the world price of crude oil and economic slowdowns caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, but less than that of smaller companies.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: DECLINING LABOR AND PURCHASE COSTS HAVE IMPROVED PROFIT
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit has increased over the past five years, accounting for an estimated 5.1% of industry revenue in 2023. Average wage and material costs are the most influential factors affecting profit. While wage costs have marginally dropped, purchases declined at a larger rate as the world price of steel fell over the past five years.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: SKILLED LABOR IS HIGHLY IMPORTANT, RESULTING IN HIGH WAGE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages have decreased over the past five years, accounting for an estimated 17.5% of industry revenue in 2023. The labor market for this industry is similar to the overall shipbuilding industry. Still, many of the industry's services are high value added, which enables offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors to generate more revenue per hour of labor compared with other shipbuilding operations. The importance of hiring skilled workers is essential for due to the scale of oil rig and platform construction.

Purchases have decreased over the past five years, accounting for an estimated 49.0% of industry revenue in 2023. The most significant cost for offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors is the purchase of raw materials, most notably steel, the primary input in fabricating oil rig and platform structures. The price of steel is often highly volatile, but has ultimately decreased over the past five years, causing purchases to drop.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Offshore oil rig and platform construction exhibits a moderate level of capital intensity. In 2023, for every $1.00 spent on wages, the industry will allocate $0.20 toward capital investment. Capital costs are high as contractors must invest in shipyards, fabrication facilities and heavy-duty equipment. Also, offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors often have support vessels aiding in the construction of platforms, further leading to higher capital costs.

There are both significant barriers to entry and a low rate of new entrants in this industry. This combination of factors dampens the threat of innovative players disrupting the industry structure. Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified. The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served my incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Offshore oil rig and platform construction exhibits a high level of revenue volatility. Construction contractors generate revenue on a given project over an extended period, while also maintaining backlogs of projects that they expect to generate revenue on in the future. Still, market conditions can drastically affect whether backlogged revenue is realized. Oil companies can delay or cancel orders for new rigs or upgrades.

volatility_points.volatility_title: VOLATILE WORLD CRUDE PRICES CAUSE SIGNIFICANT DEMAND FLUCTUATIONS
volatility_points.volatility_description: The world crude price of oil is dependent on global demand and supply. This price is often affected by political conflicts in regions with a high supply of oil. Due to this, prices may fluctuate significantly as tensions rise in a particular oil-rich region.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Offshore oil rig and platform construction may endure a degree of technological disruption as alternative energy technologies continue to advance. As more environmentally sustainable sources of energy, such as solar and wind power, continue to technologically develop and gain popularity, this is likely to cause a decline in demand for oil and natural gas, which will cause a decline in demand for offshore oil rig and platform construction services in turn.

The level of technological change in offshore oil rig and platform construction is moderate. Technological advancements are geared toward maintaining a competitive cost structure by controlling manufacturing and operating expenses. Improving and standardizing existing machinery enables offshore oil rig and platform construction contractors to reduce production costs. Product development is also important in this industry; companies employ research and development and engineering staff to develop specific solutions for customer orders.

FAQs.answer: Most operators have highly specialized and technical operations as the nature of the industry in itself is very complex.

FAQs.answer: Imports and exports do not exist in this industry as offshore platforms are by region and cannot be transported.

FAQs.answer: Drastic decreases in crude oil prices have had a devastating effect on total industry revenue over the past five years.

FAQs.answer: Some companies in the industry have embarked on acquisition activities over the past five years.

FAQs.answer: Companies constantly invest in new technologies to keep up with difficult extraction terrains that the upstream oil and gas companies operate in.

FAQs.answer: Wage costs and average wages have remained historically high in this industry.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology?
FAQs.answer: Technological innovation is a constant process in this industry.

FAQs.answer: An increase in regulation and volatile oil prices have negatively affected revenue and profitability in this industry.

FAQs.question: How have international tariffs impacted your ability to import and export products?
FAQs.answer: There are no tariffs on the industry's products.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins have increased amid declining labor and purchase costs.

FAQs.question: How has input price volatility affected profit margins over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: An expected fall in input prices in 2023 is set to boost profit margin.

FAQs.question: What benefits do you offer to retain quality staff?
FAQs.answer: The capacity to expand its workforce is often the key determinant of a company's capacity to win and complete contracts.

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your company by word-of-mouth recommendations?
FAQs.answer: Contracts are generally awarded on the basis of the operator's reputation for quality, timeliness and budget.

FAQs.question: Is your company dominant in any particular regional markets?
FAQs.answer: Companies must have locations close to key downstream markets to minimize transportation costs and better serve customers.

FAQs.question: How do fluctuating oil prices affect your company?
FAQs.answer: The price of crude oil dramatically influences this industry's performance, as upstream oil companies benefit from high prices and can be negatively affected by falling prices.

FAQs.question: How do fluctuating steel prices affect your company?
FAQs.answer: Steel accounts for a large portion of oil rig and platform construction costs.

FAQs.question: How do fluctuations in the oil and gas production index affect your company?
FAQs.answer: The US oil and gas production index measures the annual change in the production of oil and gas in the United States. Production has increased rapidly as hydraulic fracturing and horizontal drilling techniques have improved.
